comment.body:
# Remark(s)
 
:thought_balloon: Not sure if these two lines of comment are still required nowadays, by the way:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/b058daad9339b76320404d9af0ea6de20cee8390/FrenchFilter/sections/antiadblock.txt#L573-L574

issue.title: Fix #141901 www.tf1info.fr

comment.body:
# Changelog
 
### :heavy_plus_sign: Added to fix the issue

```adblock
!
! In FrenchFilter > antiadblock.txt file:
!

! https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/141901#issuecomment-1434658668
tf1.fr,tf1info.fr#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'static.adsafeprotected.com/favicon.ico method:HEAD')
tf1.fr,tf1info.fr#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', '/^https:\/\/ads\.stickyadstv\.com\/$/ method:HEAD')
```

### :heavy_plus_sign: Added as bonus _(detailed comments only present here)_

```adblock
!
! In FrenchFilter > antiadblock.txt file:
!

! Other 'set-constant' stuff will prevent the AAB check request to be done,
! while this one will ensure that even if done, the result doesn't matter.
tf1.fr#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', '__TF1_CONFIG__.featureFlag.contentAccess.isAdblockCheckRequired', 'false')
```

```adblock
!
! In FrenchFilter > general_extensions.txt file:
!

! Additional disabling of video ads (tf1info.fr side)
! in addition to the generic player iframe itself stuff (just as an extra precaution).
tf1info.fr#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', '__NEXT_DATA__.runtimeConfig.playerTF1.ads.enable', 'false')
```

### :magic_wand: Changed as bonus

- **[tf1.fr, tf1info.fr]** Did the JS rules → Scriptlets migration.
  _(Thus, improving the user experience of uBlock Origin users on these popular websites.)_

- **[tf1.fr]** Fixed the rule to hide the bottom banner (about the paid "MYTF1 MAX" offer).

### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.asahi.com/sp/articles/ASQ7V6F0HQ7VPISC00X.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.asahi.com%2Fsp%2Farticles%2FASQ7V6F0HQ7VPISC00X.html) ### Comment > #142556 > > I see three problems. > > 1. members-only features (the ability to bookmark articles to your account, the ability to gift paid articles to others) are blocked. These are website features, not social icons, and should not be blocked. > 2. there are buttons that do not disappear in mobile view. > 3. some buttons do not disappear on the page ( https://www.asahi.com/rensai/list.html?id=61 ). > > I have found that the following rules completely solve the problem. > > asahi.com#@#div[x-component-data^='{"shareUrl":'] > asahi.com##div[x-component-name="TwitterIcon"] > asahi.com##div[x-component-name="HatenaIcon"] > asahi.com##div[x-component-name="Dialog"] li:has([href^="mailto:"],[href*="facebook.com"],[href*="twitter.com"],[href*="hatena.ne.jp"],[href*="line.me"],[href*="note.com"]) > asahi.com##.UtilityBar ### Screenshots

issue.title: Add guildeducation.com domain to Optimizely

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

If users have the AdGuard enabled in their adblocking extensions, then they cannot load our feature flags and a/b tests. The effect is different across our product, such as missing new functionality, new styles, or new versions of existing capabilities. This is especially problematic when we expect all users of a customer to have access to a capability they have paid for.

Here are the websites we are having trouble with

`https://*.guildeducation.com`
`https://optimizely.guildeducation.com/*`
`https://*.guildeducation.com/optimizelydatafile=*`
`https://cdn.optimizely.com/datafiles/* with referrer from https://*.guildeducation.com`

### Proposed solution

Adding `guildeducation.com` to the AllowedList of domains for Optimizely .

### Additional information

Our company’s product, offered through [guildeducation.com](http://guildeducation.com/) does not serve any types of ads or ad-related materials. We are an education benefit provider, helping connect our users to debt-free education. We do use Optimizely for product management best practices of testing new offerings for our users.
